WorkItem.ClosedComment: This is a SimCraft issue in importing Rawr glyphs.  See http://code.google.com/p/simulationcraft/issues/detail?id=264.  Paladin glyphs are also affected.
WorkItem.Description:
Problem
======
When importing a XML file in Simcraft from a saved Rawr file, Simcraft displayed a wrong glyph combination for a destruction warlock (Conflagrate, Life Tap, Metamorphosis instead of Conflagrate, Incinerate, Life Tap). The problem is caused by Rawr 2.3.11 saving Warlock Glyphs with a bit sequence that does not match what is displayed in the GUI.
 
Analysis
=====
XML file content:
  <WarlockTalents>000000000000000000000000000003220030003000000000000000005203205210331051335230351.01000000011000000</WarlockTalents>
Binary sequence generated by me according to the GUI glyphs I have set (Conflagrate, Incinerate, Life Tap)    
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------->0100000011000000
As you can see, there's are additional "zeroes" in the bit sequence in the XML saved data, one of them in between the two "enabled" glyphs.
 
What to do
=======
If you fix it the "right way", ie, changing the XML saving code so that it matches the GUI, old XML files will load with the wrong glyph combination by Rawr.
If you fix it in another way, changing the Glyph positions in the GUI, other applications reading your XML will have to adapt, ofc.
If you don't to anything, other applications reading your XML will have to fix your bug themselves.
WorkItem.Summary: [Warlock] Wrong bit sequence in XML saved file for Glyphs
